byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels, and Sewell Chan from London.
byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and SEWELL CHAN

abstract: European Parliament issues strongest support yet for Edward J Snowden, recognizing him as 'whistle-blower and international human rights defender'; designation is non-binding and while former National Security Agency contractor is currently in Russia, no countries in Europe have offered Snowden permanent asylum to date.
lead_paragraph: A nonbinding resolution expressed strong support for Mr. Snowden, calling on European Union members to regard him as a whistle-blower and grant him protection.

headline.main: European Parliament Urges Protection for Edward Snowden
headline.print_headline: E.U. Nations Are Urged to Safeguard Snowden

snippet: A nonbinding resolution expressed strong support for Mr. Snowden, calling on European Union members to regard him as a whistle-blower and grant him protection.
